meanings.definition: Having the texture or consistency of dough.
meanings.sent1: The bread was doughier than expected, making it chewy.
meanings.sent2: Her homemade cookies were always doughier than the store-bought ones.
meanings.sent3: The doughier pizza crust turned out to be a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: The clouds in the sky looked doughier than cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The doughier playdough was easier for the kids to mold.

meanings.definition: Resembling dough in appearance or feel.
meanings.sent1: The sculpture had a doughier texture than the other art pieces.
meanings.sent2: The new sofa fabric felt doughier than the old one.
meanings.sent3: The doughier clay was perfect for shaping into animals.
meanings.sent4: Her skin felt doughier than usual after applying the moisturizer.
meanings.sent5: The doughier blanket was warmer and cozier on cold nights.
